About Me

Here are a few things to know about me...

BIO

My name is pronounced "HAY-a muh-JEED". I'm a University of Washington graduate with a Bachelor of Arts in Applied Computing and Minor in Education. When I'm not practicing solving coding problems on LeetCode you can bet I'm somewhere golfing while listening to a security and/or tech podcast. I'm fluent in English and proficient in Arabic (working on becoming fluent). My passions include cybersecurity and secure software development, that is ever-growing as we drive towards a stronger Internet of Things society.

Click the button to download my resume: 

University of Washington

Teacher Assistant

Graded, critiqued, and provided constructive criticism on assignments of students enrolled in computer science classes such as Intro to Computer Programming.

Pacific Science Center

Camps Lead Teacher

Led a group of student teachers in week-long camps to teach middle-schoolers computer programming through java and basic concepts in cybersecurity. Collaborated with University of Washington professors to organize the curriculum for each camp. Evaluated the learning style of dozens of campers in order to effectively coach students throughout camp.

Coding With Kids

Lead Instructor

Led after-school classes to teach children computer science concepts and coding skills through the block-based visual programming language Scratch.
